intro: Tetrazygiopsis brachycentra, commonly known as the short-stalked tetrazygiopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
